availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Callahill Beckner (Caldwell co., ky, farm manager )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farm manager. Virginia native. Son of Jacob Beckner. Married to Bettie Beckner. Overseer in Kanawha County, Virginia, in 1850. Farm manager in Princeton, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Kanawha County, District 29, p. 103A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 57-58.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 221B.
